items.title: Freelance Expert Interviewer at Karat () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Interviewing is broken.  Karat professionalizes interviewing.

About Karat

Karat has reengineered technical hiring to ensure that great talent gets noticed by great companies.   We augment engineering organizations by conducting the first-rounds of technical interviews on their behalf. Our service saves material engineering time and drives a highly responsive and consistent experience for candidates.  Karat continuously invests in cutting edge interview methodologies with an aim of reducing bias and letting candidates demonstrate their true ability.

We operate as strategic partners for engineering leaders at the world's leading technology companies including Jet, MuleSoft, Roblox, Intuit, Ten-X, Minted and many more.   As the gold standard of technical interviewing, our well-funded company is scaling quickly to meet our growing list of client's needs.  Come join us!

Join our elite community of Expert Interviewers.

Karat’s Expert Interviewers are recognized and rewarded for doing a first-class job as top assessors of technical talent.  Every interviewer in the network is an accomplished engineer.  Our interviewers include development managers from big-tech companies, start-up engineers and freelancers covering the full technology stack.

Flexible, high impact work that is compensated at highly competitive rates.

As an Expert Interviewer, you will be compensated at highly competitive rates for your interviewing expertise.  The time commitment is flexible---many of our interviews happen on nights and weekends.  Some experts do 10 interviews/week while others do over 25 interviews/week.  You can work from anywhere, anytime.  You will sharpen your interviewing skills and transform the interviewing experience for every candidate and company.

About Karat

Interviewing is broken.  Karat professionalizes interviewing.

  • Karat is on a mission to assess the world's talent.  We are the first dedicated marketplace for technical interviewers. Karat's network of seasoned engineers conduct the first rounds of technical interviews for elite engineering companies. Our robust platform saves teams thousands of valuable hours while allowing them to focus on the top performing candidates.  Karat's unique approach recognizes that people are central to the hiring process and that they can be supercharged by leveraging machine learning and our rich database of the world's interviews.

Benefits

Flexible Hours - You own your schedule
Work from anywhere
Transparent compensation
Bonus programs
Regular company outings
Access to a world-class community of expert interviewers

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote (US or Canada specifically)
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote (US or Canada specifically)

Looking for deep learning tutorial writers/creators to make deep learning technology screencasts.

Specifically those who know or are starting out one or more of the following technologies: TensorFlow, PyTorch, CNTK, MXNet (python, jl, c++, etc), Keras, Gluon, DL4J, DeepLearn.js, Torch, Caffe2, Caffe, Paddle, TFLearn, dlib, Theano, chainer, DIGITS, dynet....

The topic area would be yours to choose.

I would help you come up with specific tutorials to start out with.

I pay $50 USD per video, pay for your equipment, and pay ongoing royalties on a monthly basis (with a minimum royalty payout of $600 for the first year)...

I also give you suggestions on video topics so that you don't have to come up with them at the start...

I also do the video editing and transcribing for you...

if interested:

website -> https://www.aiworkbox.comemail -> sebastian@aiworkbox.com

items.title: Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe
items.content:
Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe - Jobmote

Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe

Real Audience

Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a talented data scientist. Your responsibilities will be to develop and maintain the algorithms that are being used for data processing throughout the system. In addition you will do ad-hoc data analysis, anomaly detection, track performance and contribute to the overall development of our products.

We write functional code in Clojure/Scala, but Java and working JVM knowledge is a great foundation - we will leave room for you to develop skills in the languages that are new to you. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that live in Central or Eastern European countries.

You should have a sense for:

  • selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • data mining using state-of-the-art methods

  • taking care of company’s data including addition of third party sources of information, enhancing data collection procedures, processing and verifying the integrity of data

  • working with agile methodology, such as Scrum

  • working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should have:

  • an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
  • experience with common data science toolkits and data visualisation tools
  • good understanding of Clojure/Scala/Java development and JVM
  • a university degree in math, technology, science or other relevant areas
  • impressive statistics and programming skills
  • knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Amazon AWS
  • experience with data modelling using CQL/SQL query languages
  • an interest in high software quality
  • at least five years of professional background

Additionally, you:

  • seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • are a passionate data scientist with data-oriented personality, proud of the quality of your work
  • are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • have great communication skills in spoken and written English
  • are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland, Norway or other European countries for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • live in Europe (for example Poland, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Croatia, Portugal etc.), where we currently have developers

Bonus points for:

  • an interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions

We offer:

  • an amazing opportunity to work with, and create cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence!
  • work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • no technical dept
  • stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • a great and experienced remote team
  • a permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice)
  • salary range €3000 - €5000

items.title: Real Audience: Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe
items.content:
Data scientist (mid/senior level) - Europe

Posted Nov 16

Real Audience
Headquarters: Stockholm, Sweden
http://realaudience.se

Real Audience is a Swedish tech company within the Artificial Intelligence / Big Data field, focusing on collecting and storing specific site data, do calculations on the data and help our customers to take actions based on the computed predictions.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a talented data scientist. Your responsibilities will be to develop and maintain the algorithms that are being used for data processing throughout the system. In addition you will do ad-hoc data analysis, anomaly detection, track performance and contribute to the overall development of our products.

We write functional code in Clojure/Scala, but Java and working JVM knowledge is a great foundation - we will leave room for you to develop skills in the languages that are new to you. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that live in Central or Eastern European countries.

You should have a sense for:
  • selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
  • data mining using state-of-the-art methods
  • taking care of company’s data including addition of third party sources of information, enhancing data collection procedures, processing and verifying the integrity of data
  • working with agile methodology, such as Scrum
  • working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should have:
  • an excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms
  • experience with common data science toolkits and data visualisation tools
  • good understanding of Clojure/Scala/Java development and JVM
  • a university degree in math, technology, science or other relevant areas
  • impressive statistics and programming skills
  • knowledge of Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Amazon AWS
  • experience with data modelling using CQL/SQL query languages
  • an interest in high software quality
  • at least five years of professional background

Additionally, you:
  • seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • are a passionate data scientist with data-oriented personality, proud of the quality of your work
  • are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • have great communication skills in spoken and written English
  • are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland, Norway or other European countries for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • live in Europe (for example Poland, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Croatia, Portugal etc.), where we currently have developers

Bonus points for:
  • an interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions

We offer:
  • an amazing opportunity to work with, and create cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence!
  • work in the Amazon AWS environment with a modern technology stack, such as Cassandra, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch
  • no technical dept
  • stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • a great and experienced remote team
  • a permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice)
  • salary range €3000 - €5000

Apply for this position

Please send your application together with CV and relevant links (open source contributions, Github/Stack Overflow accounts, public projects, code samples etc.) to Real Audience AB. Please also state clearly in which country you reside and will work from. Email address for applications: datascientist2017@realaudience.se

items.title: Data Application Engineer at Strong Analytics (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Industry: Big Data, Data Science, Machine Learning
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Strong Analytics is seeking an application and data engineer to collaborate with our team on developing machine learning and Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data pipelines, building RESTful APIs to trained statistical models, and deploying real-time streaming applications for continuous data processing.

This role is focused on applying and embedding machine learning solutions crafted by our team of PhD-trained data scientists. As such, it does not require deep expertise in machine learning or statistics, but rather a broad expertise in ingesting, storing, and analyzing data at scale.

To be eligible for this role, it is expected that you have experience:

  • Building and deploying Python applications to cloud-based infrastructures (e.g., AWS).
  • Writing complex SQL queries for a variety of data stores (e.g., Postgres, MySQL, Redshift).
  • Deploying (not necessarily designing/testing) machine learning pipelines and statistical models using one or more libraries, such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, or XGBoost.
  • Designing distributed applications that use workers and queues to manage asynchronous tasks.
  • Designing and building RESTful APIs.
  • Managing *nix servers via the terminal.
  • Managing and monitoring scheduled/batch jobs.
  • Writing unit tests.
  • Using continuous integration.
  • Collaborating via Git.

Ideally, you would also have experience (or an aptitude to learn about):

  • Building Apache Spark applications to analyze and learn from data at scale.
  • Building and deploying streaming applications (e.g., Spark Streaming, Akka Streams).
  • Deploying applications powered by Hadoop and/or other services provided by AWS EMR.

You do not need a PhD (or any formal education, for that matter) for this role. Applicants will be evaluated first-and-foremost on their experience and skill in the areas described above.

You should have the ability to travel infrequently (<5% of your time) for team meetups and conferences.

Remote or On-Site

This position offers 100% remote work for candidates outside the Chicago area with exceptional communication and remote collaboration skills. Candidates in the Chicago area who can work in-person with our team are preferred.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Profit sharing or equity, based on experience
  • Health insurance
  • Generous vacation policy
  • Flexible work-from-home policy
  • Company-issued MacBook Pro's

About Strong Analytics

We are a team of PhD-trained data scientists with expertise in machine learning, research and analytics, and deploying data-driven applications at scale.

We help organizations of all sizes — from new startups to Fortune 500 enterprise firms — tackle challenging analytics and machine learning projects. We help them frame their problems, design end-to-end solutions, and deploy/monitor analytics dashboards and machine learning pipelines that optimize their operations and help them build smarter products.

We are always working on new projects in a variety of industries, including the automotive, pharmaceutical, engineering, healthcare, SaaS, and consumer apps spaces. This leads to a fast-paced, learning-focused environment where we are always learning new things in collaboration with our team (and our clients' teams) in order to provide state-of-the-art solutions that work for our clients.

Benefits

Small, fun team of experts
Focus on continued learning, development, and growth
Generous vacation policy
Flexible work-from-home policy
Competitive salaries and health insurance benefits
Path to partnership through profit sharing and equity

items.title: Machine Learning Engineer f/m (100% Remote) at Jaumo GmbH (Göppingen, Germany) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Dating, Messaging, Social Networking
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We're looking for a new employee in our small five-person team and give you the opportunity to be part of a very exciting journey.

You are a Machine Learning Engineer (f/m) with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our lean and focused company. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing 100% remote company in a key position.

You will:

  • provide our fastgrowing dating app used by millions of users on a monthly basis with an intelligent and personalized experience for finding a partner
  • solve challenging problems like online dating scam/fraud/fake prevention, automated moderation, optimizing matching algorithms and our recommendation system. 
  • introduce and scale a machine learning and data processing platform
  • take ownership of your codebase
  • be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment
  • work agile with a motivated and innovative small team (us, the two founders)

Skills & Requirements

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and has a professional experience with machine learning technologies. We admire engineers who take the initiative, make their own decisions and implement them precisely. 

Your qualifications:

  • at least 3 years of experience in software development, ideally in a high-performance web or mobile environment
  • solid experience in at least one of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining or artificial intelligence
  • experience with one or more general purpose programming languages like Python, PHP, Java
  • you love getting things done you never give up, when it’s getting difficult. It’s a challenge to master every situation.
  • you speak and write business-fluent English

If this profile matches your expertise, experience, and aspirations, we’d be delighted to receive your full application, including salary requirements and possible starting date.

About Jaumo GmbH

Jaumo is one of the fastest growing dating apps worldwide with more than 30 million members in over 180 countries. The app for Android and iOS is available in 59 languages and among the Top #5 dating apps in many countries. We connect people. For fun. For love. For life.

Our company is bootstrapped and operated by just the two founders. We're not a start-up anymore, and we have proven that we built a sustainable business in a fast-growing, competitive and profitable sector.

The perks:

  • remote and flexible (work from anywhere within a timezone you choose)
  • 30 paid personal vacation days per year
  • only the best hardware and software (use what works best for you)
  • personal home office budget (2,000 € to buy what you need every 2 years)
  • make a difference (we're laser-focused and lean)

Benefits

Be our number 1 employee
Lean company - no bullshit
We work remote
Flexible schedules
Ability to work with cutting-edge technology
Competitive salary
You can make a difference
Paid time off

items.title: Senior PHP/Node.js/C++ developer - Full Time - 100% Remote EU Time Zone at Cvedia Limited (Madrid, Spain) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: Desktop Developer
Industry: Information Services
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

About the job

This is a remote, full time, long term position. As a developer in our team you will take full responsibility of your modules in a process intensive system. You will take charge of the development process from gathering requirements and system design through to the UI mockups and front end development. We require a high level of understanding the business logic involved and a critical mind to design and implement it effectively.

Experience with the following is desired

  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Working remotely with a team in multiple timezones.
  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity.
  • The ability to understand what the users and the business need.
  • Must Have: System analysis, data modelling, business process diagrams, data flow diagrams, UML.
  • Full stack development experience designing and building high volume, scalable, modular applications from top to bottom
  • Extensive proficiency with at least two RDBMSes
  • Solid professional experience in OOP using php and preferably python too.
  • Version Control
  • Linux server administration



How should you apply for this job?

Please provide your github repository

Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.

We will not reply to 3rd party software/employees agencies

Please state on the mail subject the job position and the state you reside.

Please understand that this job capacity is for a full position.



Application process:

Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.

We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.

1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!



What we offer:

Job location is in Cyberspace.

Communication with the all team members is done through Skype

Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country.

Salary will be paid once a month with a wire transfer

Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)  



About Cvedia Limited

Cvedia is a free, cloud-based service simplifying image dataset preparation and processing.

We give you direct access to standardized versions of public and private image datasets such as Open Images, COCO, ImageNet, and YouTube-8M. Using our open-source CLI tool, we directly export your filters and augmentations to your local server in the format of your favorite machine learning framework, including Torch, Caffe, TensorFlow, Theano, and Deeplearning4J. We support batch downloads and resumable states so you can start training right away.

Benefits

Remote work
Challenging environment
Young start-up with endless possibilities

items.title: C/C++ Robot Brain Engineer at Aeolus Robotics, Inc (South San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Embedded Developer

Job description

Job Responsibilities

Work with experts developing, iterating and testing robot algorithms, in one or more of these areas:

- Robot motion planning and control

- Visual modeling and perception

- Language understanding

- Grasp planning

- Firmware programming for HW/SW systems

- Other amazing robotics-based challenges!

About you

You are looking for the place to stretch yourself, able to work within a senior, highly performant product team, and aren’t afraid of a challenge.  You are a self-starter with the motivation and skills needed to effectively operate on your own time in your own way while being responsive to the needs of your teammates and the team as a whole.

You love working on the metal and/or deep in low-level or scaled algorithmic code.  You are effective at quickly understanding and operating on algorithms taken from research in AI, Robotics, and Vision, or you have have experience with sensors, motors, and other devices.  You are comfortable working alongside experts in these areas, or are an expert yourself. You have a proven track record of delivering ideas into working prototypes at high velocity.  You have commercial/agile development teaming experience.  You've architected some serious systems and may have even been a team lead.

Flexible Hours & 100% Remote Work

These roles permit flexible working hours and are 100% remote.  You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. Whether you prefer contract work or a permanent position, we can accommodate you. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

About Aeolus Robotics, Inc

Aeolus Robotics was founded to bring the first generation of household robot assistants to life, and to market. Integrating Taiwanese manufacturing prowess and Silicon Valley AI genius, we are breaking ground in general-purpose consumer robotics with capability in unstructured “human” spaces.  Our CTO, an expert in AI and machine learning, was a member of the DARPA team that conceived and managed the Watson AI project. Still operating largely in stealth mode, we’ve got additional key members and breakthrough technological approaches to ensure success in this challenging field.

items.title: Salesforce Developer - Remote (US only) at Innovate! (Alexandria, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Cloud Services, Consulting, Geographic Information System
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

As a member of the Cloud Advisory Services team, the Salesforce Developer will be expected to create unique customer-based solutions. The developer will interact with clients, prospective clients, project managers and team members, architects and other developers to ensure customer success. 

They will customize, develop and support solutions (including on the force.com platform) in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment from start to finish of multiple projects across independent platforms concurrently. They will work in partnership with project managers to gather technical requirements, research and become the subject matter expert as needed, and estimate work effort; provide production support of applications by trouble shooting issues and proposing solutions; then develop, test fixes, and migrate solution; provide ongoing support; and accurately report issues and status to project and division management. 

About Innovate!

Innovate!, Inc. (Innovate) is an 8(a) woman and minority-owned company passionate about the dynamic benefits of providing effective management consulting, IT support, and geospatial technology for the federal government. We believe that thinking innovatively can achieve positive results in organizations that lead to cultural and business change. This beliefs and our ability to deliver cutting edge solutions were recognized with Innovate being named 2012 Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Outstanding 8(a) Small Business of the Year.
 
Innovate!, Inc. also offers a comprehensive and affordable benefit program to all eligible employees.

Innovate!, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law. 
 

Benefits

Opportunities to work remotely
401(k) / Roth –The 401(k) and Roth plans offer a variety of investment
Holidays – Innovate! observes ten (10) paid holidays per year
Employee Referral Bonus - because we know you know the best people
Comprehensive health care plan
Flexible work schedules

items.title: Interview Engineer at Karat () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

About Karat

Karat has reengineered technical hiring to ensure that great talent gets noticed by great companies.   We augment engineering organizations by conducting the first-rounds of technical interviews on their behalf. Our service saves material engineering time and drives a highly responsive and consistent experience for candidates.  Karat continuously invests in cutting edge interview methodologies with an aim of reducing bias and letting candidates demonstrate their true ability. We operate as strategic partners for engineering leaders at the world's leading technology companies including Jet, MuleSoft, Roblox, Intuit, Ten-X, Minted and many more.   As the gold standard of technical interviewing, our well-funded company is scaling quickly to meet our growing list of client's needs.  Come join us!

About The Job

Our dedicated Interview Engineers are deeply passionate about the art and science of interviewing.   As an Interview Engineer, you will conduct the first-rounds of technical interviews on behalf of Karat's clients. Karat interviews take place live over video, allowing our Interview Engineers to interact with candidates from all over the world without leaving their home.  You will play an important role in the hiring process and will uphold the highest standards of candidate experience, fairness and trust.  We are very selective in hiring Interview Engineers onto the Karat platform.   Once you join our community, we will be focused on your success as a highly-regarded technical interviewer.

About You:

  • You're passionate about improving the technical interview process.
  • You care about helping others improve themselves through a great interview experience.
  • You lead with empathy and are driven to provide consistent and thoughtful feedback to candidates.
  • Your written and verbal communication skills are superb.
  • You've accumulated significant experience evaluating fundamental computer science skills (i.e. data structures, algorithms etc.), software craftsmanship (i.e. understanding of unit testing, source control, APIs etc.), and/or specific technologies (i.e. iOS, distributed systems etc.).
  • You are interested in working 40 hours per week or more.

About Karat

Interviewing is broken.  Karat professionalizes interviewing.

  • Karat is on a mission to assess the world's talent.  We are the first dedicated marketplace for technical interviewers. Karat's network of seasoned engineers conduct the first rounds of technical interviews for elite engineering companies. Our robust platform saves teams thousands of valuable hours while allowing them to focus on the top performing candidates.  Karat's unique approach recognizes that people are central to the hiring process and that they can be supercharged by leveraging machine learning and our rich database of the world's interviews.

Benefits

Flexible Hours - You own your schedule
Work from anywhere
Transparent compensation
Bonus programs
Regular company outings
Access to a world-class community of expert interviewers

items.title: Senior Machine Learning Software Engineer at Stardog Union (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Databases, Enterprise Software, Information Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

We've been actively working on adding machine learning capabilities to Stardog, and are looking for someone to help us take it to the next level.


If you're interested in natural language processing, deep learning, probabilistic graphical models, and recommender systems, this might be the job you've been dreaming about!

Responsibilities

  • Research and develop algorithms to analyze large scale (un)structured data
  • Design and develop high-performance, data-driven components for our distributed database
  • Implement complex data ingestion pipelines
  • Deploy and operationalize machine learning models


Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience on applying machine learning and natural language processing techniques to real world datasets
  • Interest in recent scientific developments, with an eye for practical applications
  • Knowledge of Vowpal Wabbit, Theano/Keras, GATE/UIMA, Lucene/ElasticSearch, and similar frameworks

About Stardog Union

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Benefits

Health care including dental & vision, some plans fully company paid
401k
3 weeks vacation
Remote work available for qualified candidates
Top of the line hardware
Flexible work schedule
Company paid life and disability benefits
Well stocked kitchen, snacks, lunch, and most importantly, coffee

items.title: Senior Web UX/UI Designer and Developer at APEX Expert Solutions (Arlington, VA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Big Data, Government, Military
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work in an fast-paced agile development environment designing and developing responsive front end websites that are able to display and manage large disparate datasets
  • Full scope web application development ranging from user experience research and design to front-end design and development
  • Provide technology recommendations for potential product application development
  • Gather and analyze requirements from product owners ensuring products meet business requirements
  • Collaborate with other software engineers and team leads in designing and developing software solutions that meet high quality standards
  • Quickly prototype and develop webpages and components specializing in visualizing large geospatial datasets using Cesium, Leaflet, D3.js, and OpenLayers 3.
  • Using Adobe Photoshop or Illustrator, create website mockups portraying design concepts
  • Assist with the design and implementation of REST API applications that provide web application connectivity to backend NoSQL datastores

Skills & Requirements

  • 5 years of building front-end websites connected to REST API
  • 3 years of building and utilizing geospatial UI libraries including Cesium, Leaflet, D3.js, and OpenLayers 3
  • 3 years of user experience design and website implementation with portfolio of past work available for review
  • Demonstrated effective and successful verbal and written communication skills
  • U.S. citizen

Desired Qualifications

  • Full life cycle software application development experience
  • Experience with distributed computing platforms including Hadoop and Cloudera
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and apply new technologies
  • Experience developing REST web services

About APEX Expert Solutions

APEX Expert Solutions delivers analytic services, technologies, and training curriculum in support of Department of Defense customers. APEX tightly couples analysts, engineers, and trainers to bring mission success.

APEX Benefits include 401k with employer matching, 15-days Paid Time Off annually plus 10 Federal Holidays, Tuition Reimbursement, Healthcare, Dental, and Vision.

Benefits

Vacations and holidays off
Cutting edge technology
Fantastic medical, dental and vision insurance
Work from home options
Social activities and events
Competitive salary and bonuses
Business casual attire
Collaborative environment

items.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer @ Stardog
items.content:
Machine Learning Software Engineer @ Stardog

2017-11-03 02:13

Description

Stardog is the world's leading Knowledge Graph platform for the Enterprise. Turn data into knowledge faster and easier. Stardog lets you query, search, and analyze enterprise data, wherever it is, using scalable, cutting-edge Knowledge Graph technology.

We've been actively working on adding machine learning capabilities to Stardog, and are looking for someone to help us take it to the next level.If you're interested in natural language processing, deep learning, probabilistic graphical models, and recommender systems, this might be the job you've been dreaming about!

Responsibilities

  • Research and develop algorithms to analyze large scale (un)structured data
  • Design and develop high-performance, data-driven components for our distributed database
  • Implement complex data ingestion pipelines
  • Deploy and operationalize machine learning models

Requirements:

  • 5+ years programming experience, ideally in Java
  • Strong computer science fundamentals, with advanced knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience on applying machine learning and natural language processing techniques to real world datasets
  • Interest in recent scientific developments, with an eye for practical applications
  • Knowledge of Vowpal Wabbit, Theano/Keras, GATE/UIMA, Lucene/ElasticSearch, and similar frameworks
  • Ability to work in a distributed team mainly communicating over email, chat, and phone
  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus

We have offices in Arlington, VA and Boston, MA. Remote working is also possible for qualified candidates.

Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins.

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Data Scientist/ Machine Learning Architect
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA boring, as someone with machine learning expertise, you may have always thought "there must be a better way"!
Do you love building new stuff, learning and working with emerging technologies, alongside a team of skilled engineers with the same passion as yours? Driven to build a unique and groundbreaking product? Want to work on something that has not been done before?
If so, we would like to hear from you.


About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, building the next generation of testing automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology using machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with machine learning expertise to join our team


REQUIREMENTS

Since we're building emerging technology, we're looking for solid engineering skills and experience, with solid knowledge of the theoretical fundamentals. Most importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, a passion to learn/grow independently and willingness to delve into problems.

We have our eyes on a few skills, namely:

Strong practical experience and theoretical background in machine learning.
Strong programming skills in at least one major programming language (e.g., Java, C++, Python)
A postgraduate degree (preferably PhD) in a relevant machine learning topic is desirable.
Ability to apply cross-domain knowledge to solve new machine-learning problems, and able to create/apply a multitude of ML solutions to solve a problem from different angles.
Can demonstrate expertise in neural networks/deep-learning techniques, RNNs, CNNs, LSTMs.
Polyglot: can program effectively in a wide range of programming languages and frameworks.


BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Possibility of working remotely is available.
Personal development by working with a fast growing multinational startup aiming to shape the future of Digital QA.
